question: Which of the following halides cannot be hydrolysed?
explanation: Hydrolysis requires the central atom to accept lone pairs from water into vacant d-orbitals.
Carbon (in CCl₄) does not have vacant d-orbitals in its valence shell (Period 2).
Si, Ge, and Sn (Period 3+) have vacant d-orbitals and can be hydrolysed.
